title: Type in the Wild
content:
For my current project, I am required to find real world examples of my chosen typeface (Emigre’s Dalliance).

Does anyone know of any designs or anything that use Dalliance?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [FTDal.GIF](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203220707/http:/typophile.com/files/FTDal.GIF) | 24.1 KB |

 [‹ Distressed Gill Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203220707/http:/www.typophile.com/node/41559 "Go to previous forum topic") [Contact Information Layout ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203220707/http:/www.typophile.com/node/41482 "Go to next forum topic")
author: bmcnally

comments.content:
I hope [Dalliance Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203220707/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/emigre/dalliance_script/) counts.

The [LunaBrand](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203220707/http:/www.lunabrands.com/) logo is set in the script and the [Love Made Visible](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203220707/http:/www.pomegranita.com/) blog uses it for their headlines. See also this [sunflower oil](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203220707/http:/brandient.com/en/portfolio/case_studies/picasol/).

Hi Brad,

sometimes Flickr is a good place to find examples of fonts in use. For Dalliance, check out these photos by dotsara and Robot Johnny: [[1]](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203220707/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/dotsara/16534348/), [[2]](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203220707/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/dotsara/4631803/), [[3]](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203220707/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/robotjohnny/24201356/).  
F

See Dalliance Script here, used for the author’s name.

[http://shop.mnhs.org/moreinfomhspress.cfm?Product\_ID=252](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203220707/http:/shop.mnhs.org/moreinfomhspress.cfm?Product_ID=252 "http://shop.mnhs.org/moreinfomhspress.cfm?Product\_ID=252")

& the book is a very nice 4-hour read if long canoe trips are your thing.

powers

Another book cover: [Colorful Stitchery](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203220707/http:/www.amazon.com/Colorful-Stitchery-Embroidery-Projects-Personalize/dp/1580176119/ref=pd_bbs_sr_1?ie=UTF8&s=books&qid=1201703430&sr=1-1). (Dalliance is also used throughout the interior for project titles.)

logo I designed (with customized K):

[http://www.mayakaimal.com/index.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203220707/http:/www.mayakaimal.com/index.html "http://www.mayakaimal.com/index.html")

It is frequently used for books by Indian and other Asian writers (as evidenced in the links above), which is frustrating to me because it makes my logo above look like a bit of a cliche. I designed that logo when the font was really new, though, and not overused for Asian themes like it is now. I remember it also from a book I read awhile back about growing up in Afghanistan but I can’t remember the title.

I also used it for the title of this book:

http://www.powerhousebooks.com/books!/PleasurePalaces/

and made extensive use of the ornaments inside.
